'''''Tolkien Studies'': Volume 9''', published in [[2012]], is the ninth volume of the annual review ''[[Tolkien Studies (journal)|Tolkien Studies]]''.
{{Tolkienstudiesnav|8|10}}

==Contents==
* Articles
** [[Peter Grybauskas]], "Untold Tales: Solving a Literary Dilemma"
** Gerard Hynes, "'Beneath the Earth's dark keel': Tolkien and Geology"
** [[Douglas C. Kane]], "Law and Arda"
** Amelia A. Rutledge, "'Justice is not Healing': J.R.R. Tolkien's Pauline Constructs in 'Finwë and Míriel'"

* Book Reviews 
** ''[[Tolkien and Wales]]: Language, Literature and Identity'', by Carl Phelpstead, reviewed by Marjorie Burns
** ''[[Middle-earth and Beyond]]: Essays on the World of J.R.R. Tolkien'', edited by Kathleen Dubs and Janka Kascáková, reviewed by John D. Rateliff
** ''[[The Ecological Augury in the Works of JRR Tolkien|The Ecological Augury in the Works of J.R.R. Tolkien]]'', by Liam Campbell, reviewed by Kristine Larsen
** ''[[Tolkien and the Study of His Sources]]'', edited by Jason Fisher, reviewed by Paul Edmund Thomas
** ''[[Picturing Tolkien]]: Essays on Peter Jackson's The Lord of the Rings Film Trilogy'', edited by Janice M. Bogstad and Philip E. Kaveny, reviewed by Anne C. Petty
** ''[[The Ring and the Cross]]: Christianity and The Lord of The Rings'', edited by Paul E. Kerry, and ''[[Light Beyond All Shadow]]: Religious Experience in Tolkien's Work'', edited by Paul E. Kerry and Sandra Miesel, reviewed by Jonathan Evans

* David Bratman and Merlin DeTardo, "The Year's Work in Tolkien Studies 2009"
* Rebecca Epstein, Michael D.C. Drout, David Bratman, and Merlin DeTardo, "Bibliography (in English) for 2010"

==External links==
